info.title: Storm Glass
info.description: The Storm Glass API allows you to fetch weather data for any coordinate on the globe in a simple, programmatic way using conventional HTTP requests

airTemperature1000hpa.description: Air temperature at 1000hpa in degrees celsius

airTemperature100m.description: Air temperature at 100m above sea level in degrees celsius

airTemperature200hpa.description: Air temperature at 200hpa in degrees celsius

airTemperature500hpa.description: Air temperature at 500hpa in degrees celsius

airTemperature800hpa.description: Air temperature at 800hpa in degrees celsius

airTemperature80m.description: Air temperature at 80m above sea level in degrees celsius

currentDirection.description: Direction of current. 0° indicates current coming from north

currentSpeed.description: Speed of current in meters per second

gust.description: Wind gust in meters per second

secondarySwellDirection.description: Direction of secondary swell waves. 0° indicates swell coming from north

secondarySwellHeight.description: Height of secondary swell waves in meters

secondarySwellPeriod.description: Period of secondary swell waves in seconds

swellDirection.description: Direction of swell waves. 0° indicates swell coming from north

swellHeight.description: Height of swell waves in meters

swellPeriod.description: Period of swell waves in seconds

waveDirection.description: Direction of combined wind and swell waves. 0° indicates waves coming from north

waveHeight.description: Significant Height of combined wind and swell waves in meters

wavePeriod.description: Period of combined wind and swell waves in seconds

windDirection.description: Direction of wind at 10m above sea level. 0° indicates wind coming from north

windDirection1000hpa.description: Direction of wind at 1000hpa. 0° indicates wind coming from north

windDirection100m.description: Direction of wind at 100m above sea level. 0° indicates wind coming from north

windDirection200hpa.description: Direction of wind at 200hpa. 0° indicates wind coming from north

windDirection20m.description: Direction of wind at 20m above sea level. 0° indicates wind coming from north

windDirection30m.description: Direction of wind at 30m above sea level. 0° indicates wind coming from north

windDirection40m.description: Direction of wind at 40m above sea level. 0° indicates wind coming from north

windDirection500hpa.description: Direction of wind at 500hpa. 0° indicates wind coming from north

windDirection50m.description: Direction of wind at 50m above sea level. 0° indicates wind coming from north

windDirection800hpa.description: Direction of wind at 800hpa. 0° indicates wind coming from north

windDirection80m.description: Direction of wind at 80m above sea level. 0° indicates wind coming from north

windSpeed.description: Speed of wind at 10m above sea level in meters per second.

windSpeed1000hpa.description: Speed of wind at 1000hpa in meters per second.

windSpeed100m.description: Speed of wind at 100m above sea level in meters per second

windSpeed200hpa.description: Speed of wind at 200hpa in meters per second.

windSpeed20m.description: Speed of wind at 20m above sea level in meters per second.

windSpeed30m.description: Speed of wind at 30m above sea level in meters per second.

windSpeed40m.description: Speed of wind at 40m above sea level in meters per second.

windSpeed500hpa.description: Speed of wind at 500hpa in meters per second.

windSpeed50m.description: Speed of wind at 50m above sea level in meters per second.

windSpeed800hpa.description: Speed of wind at 800hpa in meters per second.

windSpeed80m.description: Speed of wind at 80m above sea level in meters per second.

windWaveDirection.description: Direction of wind waves. 0° indicates waves coming from north

windWaveHeight.description: Height of wind waves in meters

windWavePeriod.description: Period of wind waves in seconds

get.description: The weather request is used to fetch weather data for a point. To get marine data you include a coordinate at sea in your request, and to get data for land and lakes - simply send in a coordinate located on land or on a lake.

parameters.name: params
parameters.description: Comma separeted list of parameters, Eg swellHeight,waveHeight

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Timestamp in UTC for first forecast hour - UNIX format or URL encoded ISO format.

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: Timestamp in UTC for last forecast hour - UNIX format or URL encoded ISO format.

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: Specify a single source or a comma separated list of sources. Eg noaa or dwd,noaa

chlorophyll.description: Mass concentration of chlorophyll a in sea water

iron.description: Mole concentration of dissolved iron in sea water

nitrate.description: Mole concentration of nitrate in sea water

oxygen.description: Mole concentration of dissolved molecular oxygen in sea water

ph.description: Sea water ph reported on total scale

phosphate.description: Mole concentration of phosphate in sea water

phyto.description: Net primary production of biomass expressed as carbon per unit volume in sea water

salinity.description: Sea water salinity given in per mille

silicate.description: Mole concentration of silicate in sea water

soilMoisture.description: Volumetric soil moisture content at 0 to 10 cm below surface

soilMoisture100cm.description: Volumetric soil moisture content at 100 to 200 cm below surface

soilMoisture10cm.description: Volumetric soil moisture content at 10 to 40 cm below surface

soilMoisture40cm.description: Volumetric soil moisture content at 40 to 100 cm below surface

soilTemperature.description: Soil temperature at 0 to 10 cm below surface

soilTemperature100cm.description: Soil temperature at 100 to 200 cm below surface

soilTemperature10cm.description: Soil temperature at 10 to 40 cm below surface

soilTemperature40cm.description: Soil temperature at 40 to 100 cm below surface

get.description: The bio request is used to fetch bio related data for a point.

type.description: Type of extreme. Either low or high

distance.description: Distance between station and requested coordinate in km

meta.description: The meta object contains information about the API request. Such as requested latitude and longitude, your daily quota and how many requests you’ve made so far today

get.description: Retrieve information about high and low tide for a single coordinate. If nothing is specified, the returned values will be in relative to Mean Sea Level - MSL.

distance.description: Distance between station and requested coordinate in km

meta.description: The meta object contains information about the API request. Such as requested latitude and longitude, your daily quota and how many requests you’ve made so far today

get.description: Retrieve the sea level given in meters hour by hour for a single coordinate. If nothing is specified the returned values will be in relative to Mean Sea Level - MSL.
The Tide Stations List Requests is used to list all available stations.
The Tide Stations Area Request will list all available tide stations within a defined geographic area.

parameters.name: box
parameters.description: Top right and bottom left coordinate of box on format: lat,lng:lat,lng

get.description: Retrieve sunrise, sunset, moonrise, moonset and moon phase for a single coordinate.

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: For how many days ahead to receive data. max 31 days.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Timestamp in UTC for first forecast hour - UNIX format or URL encoded ISO format.

uvIndex.description: Ultraviolet (UV) radiation at ground or sea level

downwardShortWaveRadiationFlux.description: Downward short-wave radiation flux, GHI (W m⁻²) at ground or sea level

Data.description: The data object contains the actual bio data on an hourly basis.

get.description: The bio request is used to fetch bio related data for a point.

elevation.description: The elevation value given in meters relative to sea level.
elevation.title: Elevation

get.description: The elevation request is used to fetch elevation data (bathymetry for oceans and topography for land) for a point. The Storm Glass API provides elevation data globally.
